bibl.title: Endorsements regarding Commissioner of Pensions, December 1901

div1.p: Endorsements requests history and personal description of Reed, along with information on next of kin. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Endorsements regarding Commissioner of Pensions, December 1901
div1.p:
OFFICE OF ADJUTANT GENERAL
DEC. 11
1902
464774
WAR DEPARTMENT

Bureau of Pensions
Washn. DC, Dec 9/02

Requests military history
and personal description, etc. of
Walter Reed, Commissioned June-
26- 1875, as a Major Med Dept, and
died Nov 23-1903, at Washington
DC; also name and address of
persons given by soldier as next of
kin.

Rec'd orig #774348, Emily
Lawrence Reed- wid Walter Reed
Maj. Med Dept-USA,

wrapper.
Dec 18, original returned
to Pension Office, this
P & P. (as per copy herein

Respectfully returned to the Com-
mssioner of Pensions with a statement
of the military service of the late
Major Walter Reed, U. S. Army and copies
of letters of Major W.C. Borden, Surgeon,
dated November 2 and December 6, 1902,
herewith. (46085 AGO.)

Name and address of nearest rela-
tive are not of record.

V. P. Hall
Acting Adjutant General
By W.A.K.
